nodes.name: SEC Cybersecurity Disclosure Rules
nodes.description: Rules requiring public companies to disclose material cybersecurity incidents and annual cybersecurity risk management, strategy, and governance.

nodes.name: Material Incident Disclosure
nodes.description: Real-time reporting of material cybersecurity incidents

nodes.name: Annual Risk Management
nodes.description: Disclosure of risk management strategy and governance

nodes.name: Board Oversight
nodes.description: Disclosure of board's role in cyber oversight
Must disclose material incidents within 4 business days
nodes.title: Item 1.05 Material Incident

nodes.description: Describe processes for assessing identifying and managing material risks
nodes.title: Item 106(b) Risk Management

nodes.description: Describe board's oversight of cybersecurity risks
nodes.title: Item 106(c)(1) Board Oversight

nodes.description: Describe management's role in assessing and managing material risks
nodes.title: Item 106(c)(2) Management Role

nodes.name: Form 10-K Item 106
nodes.description: Annual report for risk and governance

nodes.name: Form 20-F Item 16K
nodes.description: Annual report for foreign private issuers

nodes.primaryResponsibility: Oversight of financial and cyber risk
nodes.name: Audit Committee
Financial
nodes.description: Loss of revenue or increased costs

nodes.name: Risk Identification
nodes.description: Process for discovering potential cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities

nodes.name: Risk Assessment
nodes.description: Evaluating the likelihood and impact of identified cybersecurity risks

nodes.name: Risk Monitoring
nodes.description: Ongoing surveillance of the risk landscape and security posture

nodes.name: Vendor Due Diligence
nodes.description: Assessing the cybersecurity posture of third-party service providers

nodes.name: Materiality Determination
nodes.description: Process of assessing whether an incident has a material impact on the company

nodes.name: NIST CSF
nodes.description: National Institute of Standards and Technology Framework

nodes.name: Reasonable Investor Test
nodes.definition: Likelihood a reasonable investor would consider the info important
